<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/07e4a197953d12902fb97beb48830a5323a52280|patch 8.1.2343: using time() for srand() is not very random>
patch 8.1.2343: using time() for srand() is not very random

Problem:    Using time() for srand() is not very random.
Solution:   use /dev/urandom if available

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.1.2343: using time() for srand() is not very random · vim/vim@07e4a19
attachments.title: patch 8.1.2343: using time() for srand() is not very random · vim/vim@07e4a19
attachments.text: Problem: Using time() for srand() is not very random. Solution: use /dev/urandom if available

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6a228c6463935a73c8f21142cb7368545cfee317|patch 8.1.2344: Cygwin: warning for using strptime()>
patch 8.1.2344: Cygwin: warning for using strptime()

Problem:    Cygwin: warning for using strptime().
Solution:   Move defining _XOPEN_SOURCE and __USE_XOPEN to vim.h. (Ken Takata,
            closes #5265)  Use 700 for _XOPEN_SOURCE for mkdtemp().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.1.2344: Cygwin: warning for using strptime() · vim/vim@6a228c6
attachments.title: patch 8.1.2344: Cygwin: warning for using strptime() · vim/vim@6a228c6
attachments.text: Problem: Cygwin: warning for using strptime(). Solution: Move defining _XOPEN_SOURCE and __USE_XOPEN to vim.h. (Ken Takata, closes #5265) Use 700 for _XOPEN_SOURCE for mkdtemp().

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c1faf3dc3879e8a5e486f31445b5a5753dcbc6a3|patch 8.1.2345: .cjs files are not recognized as Javascript>
patch 8.1.2345: .cjs files are not recognized as Javascript

Problem:    .cjs files are not recognized as Javascript.
Solution:   Add the *.cjs pattern. (closes #5268)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.1.2345: .cjs files are not recognized as Javascript · vim/vim@c1faf3d
attachments.title: patch 8.1.2345: .cjs files are not recognized as Javascript · vim/vim@c1faf3d
attachments.text: Problem: .cjs files are not recognized as Javascript. Solution: Add the *.cjs pattern. (closes #5268)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/38571a04b4eb2853f46df8884750bcb9a8115db8|patch 8.1.2346: CTRL-R CTRL-R doesn't work with modifyOtherKeys>
patch 8.1.2346: CTRL-R CTRL-R doesn't work with modifyOtherKeys

Problem:    CTRL-R CTRL-R doesn't work with modifyOtherKeys.
Solution:   Allow key codes when fetching argument for CTRL-R. (closes #5266)
            Also fix CTRL-G in Insert mode.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.1.2346: CTRL-R CTRL-R doesn't work with modifyOtherKeys · vim/vim@38571a0
attachments.title: patch 8.1.2346: CTRL-R CTRL-R doesn't work with modifyOtherKeys · vim/vim@38571a0
attachments.text: Problem: CTRL-R CTRL-R doesn't work with modifyOtherKeys. Solution: Allow key codes when fetching argument for CTRL-R. (closes #5266) Also fix CTRL-G in Insert mode.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/84f903326d44db9b75fc3a39d4866f636f9ad4cd|patch 8.1.2347: MacOS: build fails>
patch 8.1.2347: MacOS: build fails

Problem:    MacOS: build fails.
Solution:   Don't define _XOPEN_SOURCE for Mac.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.1.2347: MacOS: build fails · vim/vim@84f9033
attachments.title: patch 8.1.2347: MacOS: build fails · vim/vim@84f9033
attachments.text: Problem: MacOS: build fails. Solution: Don't define _XOPEN_SOURCE for Mac.
